column5: Pan American Silver Corp  became the latest company to curtail operations in Mexico due to rising violence and crime  saying on Monday it has faced security incidents along the roads used to transport personnel and materials to its Dolores mine.

column4: Civil rights advisers hope Starbucks' anti-bias training sets example
column5: LOS ANGELES  May 28 Black leaders who are advising Starbucks Corp on its anti-bias training program  which begins Tuesday  hope it will reinvigorate decades-old efforts to ensure minorities get equal treatment in restaurants and stores  setting an example for other corporations.

column5: JOHANNESBURG  May 28 ArcelorMittal's South Africa unit will sell its 50 percent stake in trading and shipping company MIHBV to its joint venture partner Macsteel Holdings Luxembourg (MacHold) for $220 million  the steel maker said on Monday.

column4: NORWEGIAN STOCKS-Frontline gains on outlook for more OPEC oil
column5: OSLO  May 28 (Reuters) - * Norwegian shares traded up on Monday  recovering from last week's losses * Oslo's benchmark index rose 0.94 pct  or 8.12 points  to 872.10 points and was up by 6.08 pct year-to-date * The broader Oslo All Share Index was up 0.91 percent * Brent crude futures  a trigger for the oil heavy Oslo Bourse  fell $-1.03 to $75.41 a barrel * Saudi Arabia and Russia set to raise supplies by 1 million bpd  U.S. production keeps rising * Among the biggest firms on the Oslo Bourse

column4: Israel real estate developer Gazit-Globe Q1 loss widens
column5: * Gazit-Globe   Israel's largest real-estate company  recorded on Monday a wider loss in first-quarter net profit and declared it would pay a quarterly dividend of 73 million shekels ($20.5 million).

column4: Petrobras management urges workers not to strike -document
column5: SAO PAULO  May 28 State controlled-oil giant Petroleo Brasileiro SA's management on Monday urged its workers not to follow through on a strike planned for later in the week  saying that "paralysis and pressure for adjusting prices" would not be positive for the company or country as a whole.

column5: BRASILIA  May 28 Petrobras shares fell as much as 9 percent on Monday after Brazil's government offered new fuel subsidies and changed the oil producer's pricing policy in a bid to settle a truckers' strike that has shuttered factories and caused food and fuel shortages.

column5: SAO PAULO  May 28 Brazil's state-controlled oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA said in a securities filing that its diesel prices will be fixed for 60 days and after that will be adjusted monthly.
